topic.title: How to Index Japanese Content in WebHelp Classic

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: To optimize the indexing of Japanese content in WebHelp pages, the Lucene Kuromoji Japanese analyzer can be used. This analyzer is included in the Oxygen XML Editor/Author installation kit.

section.title: Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p:
To activate the Japanese indexing in your WebHelp output using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Set the language for your content to Japanese. Edit a DocBook to WebHelp transformation scenario and in the Parameters tab, set the value of the l10n.gentext.default.language parameter to ja.
Run the WebHelp transformation scenario to generate the output.

section.title: Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

note.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

section.p:
To activate the Japanese indexing in your WebHelp output using a script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Set the language for your content to Japanese. Use the l10n.gentext.default.language parameter in your transformation script and set its value to ja.
Execute the transformation script.
